reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I started our honeymoon in Rome and spent three nights at Capo d'Africa. We found the hotel to be very comfortable, a great place from which to explore the city.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Start to Our Honeymoon

likes.liked: — Location, Room Size, Cleanliness, Decor, Breakfast

reviews.text: Our room was a "De Luxe," which might have meant that it was a bit bigger than normal. Lots of space, but not much furniture. It would have been great to have a sofa or loveseat to sit on after exploring the city. We liked the modern colors and decor. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was terrific. We found breakfast to be exceptional -- plenty to start the day. A nice variety of food, fresh fruit and excellent espresso. The breakfast staff did a great job and the breakfast room and patio are beautiful.
reviews.title: Great time at Capo d'Africa

reviews.text: We were excited to spend some time exploring Imperial Rome, so the location was a plus. It always delighted us to see the Coliseum at the beginning of our day. We walked quite a bit, but ended up in taxis often. There are some restaurants near the hotel, but I was surprised the staff didn't recommend anything nearby for dinner. ATMs, several small markets and at least one pharmacy are within a couple of blocks.
reviews.title: Okay, but some problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was able to pay for high-speed Internet access on a public terminal in the lobby, which was nice. There is a full bar in the lobby -- we never got a chance to visit it. We didn't use the TV or room service, so I can't comment on there.
reviews.title: Nice but...

reviews.text: I decided against giving Capo d'Africa 5 stars. Our experience was overwhelmingly positive, but there is room for improvement. The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful, but perhaps a little impersonal. Also, there were several occasions in which there was only one person at the desk. A dedicated concierge would go a long way here. As an aside, I'm not so sure about their restaurant recommendations -- one was very good, another was touristy and unexceptional.
reviews.title: It is as good as everyone says

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very impressed with the friendly staff, comfortable rooms and ideal location of the hotel in a quiet area but within easy walking distance of tourist sights. The only criticism that I can make is the minor problem that we had when paying the bill at the end of the stay - we had booked directly with them in January and had written confirmation of the room rates but they had tried to charge us a higher room rate when we checked out. We spotted the mistake straight away and it was resolved immediately when we showed them the paperwork confirming the original price. Overall, this is a good city-centre hotel that we would use again.
reviews.title: Very good stay - but check your bill!

reviews.text: What makes Capo d'Africa a must stay in Rome is the staff. Friendly, helpful, polite and willing to do whatever they can to make sure you are accomodated. The hotel has a cosmopolitan flair without going overboard. The two rooms we booked were finished with cherry wood trim and high ceilings that increased your feeling of space. Though not as large by American standards, they were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet served on the rooftop terrace was not great (though adequate)but after a couple of expresso's we were ready to go. This was our first stop on a 4 stop tour in Italy and my one big question is, What is up with ice?
reviews.title: Did not dissapoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are no ice stations in any of the hotels. If you want ice, you must ask for it. Though not required, you still feel obligated to one euro per delivery. Also for the ladies, the hair dryer is secured to the desk in the bedroom. ?? The work out room is adequate for a vacation workout and is also finished off with cherry wood trim giving it a really nice look.
reviews.title: A perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great. Walking distance to most of the things you want to see and a train station stop that will get you to all others.
reviews.title: Hotel lived up to fantastic expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best hotel situated near the Colosseum, the only down side is that it does not have an evening resturant, but with so much to chose from you will not go hungary! Try to stay away from eating at the resturants over looking the Colosseum as these charge top prices and the food is not always the best! also it is recommended that you get up early if you want to view the Colosseum you beat the crowds and have it to yourself before the coaches arrive. Although the hotel is away from the Spanish Steps, Trivi Fourtain areas, a taxi is not too expensive and walking will take approx 1/2 hour depending on how hot is it!. Another plus for staying in this hotel is that the area is a little Bohemian so resturants are cheaper, A whole Lobster around the Spanish Steps area will set you back Approx €65 the one I had near the hotel cost €35, and it was fresh. What to wear? well I was scared off by reports that in Rome people dressed up and this is true to a point around the posher areas, the Colosseum area, jeans and t-shirts were fine, so too were shorts, just wear what you feel comfortable in esp during the day. The hotel itself was great! the rooms although small were clean and there was little noise in the evening. It was lovely to sit on the roof terrace enjoying a drink or to (although a tip is to buy a bottle of wine at the small wine shop just down from the hotel on the corner and bring it back!) much cheaper! breakfast was good, you can see the Colosseum from the hotel only if you breakfast on the small terrace on the left of the hotel roof, unfortunately this is not open in the evening. I cannot really fault this hotel, except to say I wish it had a swimming pool !
reviews.title: a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked 2 twin rooms 4 months in advance of a trip to this hotel. Upon arrival at the hotel we were somewhat horrified to be told that 2 of us were going to have to share a double bed. We were 4 middle-aged women on a weekend away and the last thing we wanted was to share a bed. After some heated discussions the hotel put another bed in the already crammed room. This hotel isn’t cheap so to have to sleep on a put you up was totally unacceptable. Added to this the staff are rude and the overall atmosphere in the hotel is cold and unfriendly. To top it all, we were taken to the airport by a hotel driver who had little regard for his own life let alone ours. Even given Italian standards it was reckless. I booked this hotel after reading reviews in travel guides but this is the last time I will be trusting the info in one of those!
reviews.title: As good as the reviews suggest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel, clean, air-conditioning, rooms are great, we had a king-size bed, clean sheets and towels every day! Staff friendly and helpful. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversay and the hotel very generously left a bottle of bubbly for us on our first night there!
reviews.title: Enjoy Rome in style!

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel and will hopefully return to Rome and stay here again!
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We based our stay on reviews here. Our family of 4 loved the connecting rooms which were gorgeous. The rooftop was beautiful and the staff was perfect.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We worried that the location would be too "out of the way" and that maybe we should stay near the Spanish Steps--but that fear was totally unfounded. It turns out the the nearby "Monte" neighborhood is the new happening spot. The Capo D'africa neighborhood was perfect, quiet and very nice residential. There are great restaurants, Il Bocconcino was fantastic. Taverna Romana, wonderful also. Not fancy places, but really good bistro's.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Experience

likes.liked: — The accomodations: room size, bed, breakfast terrace.

reviews.text: Rome is definitely a walking city so if you aren't a walker, stay somewhere else but we loved our strolls, even with the heat. Don't miss the gelato right around the corner. Our favorite in Rome. We'll be back someday.
reviews.title: Excellent
